definition: Titus (1st century AD), Christian missionary, disciple of St. Paul
to carry (hanging down from the hand)/to lift/to put forward/to mention/to raise (an issue)/upwards character stroke/lifting brush stroke (in painting)/scoop for measuring liquid
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
Epistle of St Paul to Titus

sentences.english: Titus did not take advantage of you, did he?
sentences.chinese: 提多佔過你們的便宜麼？

sentences.english: What are Paul's closing instructions to Titus in this chapter?
sentences.chinese: 保羅在這一章對提多的結束勸勉是什麼？

sentences.english: Did Titus make a gain of you?
sentences.chinese: 提多佔過你們的便宜嗎。

sentences.english: Cor. 12:18 I entreated Titus and sent with him the brother.
sentences.chinese: 林後十二18我勸了提多，又差了那位弟兄同去。

sentences.english: But thanks be to God, which put the same earnest care into the heart of Titus for you.
sentences.chinese: 多謝神，感動提多的心，叫他待你們殷勤，像我一樣。

definition: contraction of 不用[bu4 yong4]/need not/please don't
to make sb change their ways, opinions etc
vigorously/to the utmost/to the best of one's ability
cheerful and optimistic/in a good mood/gaily
to make a scene/to fool around/to behave foolishly
